item.title: JB Emmons
item.description: I've now seen multiple folks citing the 11th Circuit's 2006 decision in US v. Martin as grounds for arguing that Judge #Cannon can be forced to recuse in the #Trump documents prosecution.While I agree that Cannon 𝘴𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘭𝘥 recuse, for the reasons stated in Martin and elsewhere, I would caution against reading the case as 𝘳𝘦𝘲𝘶𝘪𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 anything of the sort at this stage.The principle is one thing; getting to the point where the 11th Circuit will actually act on that principle is another.#LawFedi

item.title: Caroline Orr Bueno
item.description:
In the aftermath of Trump’s indictment, several good articles were written about right-wing calls for violence on fringe platforms. But in my latest piece, I focused on mainstream Republicans who are promoting violence, declaring war, and calling on people to take up arms & organize militias. The findings were alarming — and left me w/ the impression that they believe the war has already begun.
https://weaponizedspaces.substack.com/p/declaration-of-war-right-wing-calls?utm_source=twitter&sd=pf

item.title: Hilda Bastian
item.description: 17 studies plus advertising data map out Twitter's decline. My latest post @PLOS https://absolutelymaybe.plos.org/2023/06/07/17-studies-plus-advertising-data-map-out-twitters-decline/I tackled 5 questions that look at decline in quality & quantity from various angles. The answer to all of them was worse than I'd expected.As much as a third of Twitter users have either left, or are tweeting less...But the far right, hate, & misinfo are booming. Promoted tweets are shifting in worrying directions, too.

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description:
Our lab at UCL (https://www.ucl.ac.uk/cortexlab) is looking for a Research Technician. It is an exciting opportunity to practice research in computational and experimental #neuroscience. Ideal for those who wish to have strong research experience before considering PhD studies.The job involves training mice to perform a task and recording their brain activity with techniques such as 2-photon imaging and Neuropixels recordings.To learn more and apply: https://www.ucl.ac.uk/cortexlab/positions
Deadline: 20 June.

item.title: Sheril Kirshenbaum
item.description: I often wish our children could vote bc today’s policies define their future health, safety & well-being in a rapidly changing world.And most of the folks with power to make decisions at the national level won’t be part of that future, so for them, short-term choices are more personal than long-term hypotheticals.But our kids can’t vote. So it’s on us to be their voice in the years to come.

item.title: Prof. Mayank R Mehta, UCLA
item.description:
Speaking at conferences increases citations by 52%!
https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-01604-xBut
-In person meeting requires airline travel, fuels greenhouse gases.
-Less wealthy can't afford to travel or get visas. Referees prefer papers from known/famous authors. In person conferences create a vicious cycle.
-"I invite you, you invite me" enables nepotism.
-A handful of famous voices dominate the airwaves.
-This stifles the young investigators and disruptive innovation.What's the solution?
